questiontext.text:
Exercise

Which of the following are probability density functions?


\[\text{(iii)} \qquad f(x) = \left\{\begin{array}{ll} x^2 - 4x + \dfrac{10}{3}, & \text{for all $0 \leq x \leq 3$}\\ 0, & \text{elsewhere.} \end{array}\right. \]

generalfeedback.text:
Solution

(i) We can write this function as \[f(x) = \left\{\begin{array}{ll} x, & \text{for all $0 \leq x \leq 1$} \\ 0, & \text{elsewhere.} \end{array}\right. \] We have that \( f(x) \geq 0\) for all \(x\), but we have that \( \displaystyle{\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}} f(x) \; dx = \displaystyle{\int_0^1} x \; dx = \dfrac{1}{2}.\) Thus this function is not a valid probability density function because the integralâ€™s value is not \(1\).

(ii) We can write this function as \[ f(x) = \left\{\begin{array}{ll} 1 -\dfrac{x}{2}, & \text{for all $0 \leq x \leq 2$} \\ 0, & \text{elsewhere.} \end{array}\right. \] We have that \( f(x) \geq 0\) for all \(x\), and we have that \( \displaystyle{\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}} f(x) \; dx = \int_0^2 1 -\dfrac{x}{2} \; dx = 1.\) Thus, this function is a valid probability density function.

(iii) We have that \( \displaystyle{\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}} f(x) \; dx = \int_0^3 x^2 - 4x + \dfrac{10}{3} \; dx = 1.\) But, we see that \(f(x)<0 \) for \(\dfrac{3}{2} \leq x \leq \dfrac{5}{2}.\) Hence, because \(f(x)\) takes on negative values, it is not a valid probability density function.
